ygData.subject: Can't we all just get along?
ygData.msgSnippet: Phobia stood back watching the exchange. I d trust a Mechanibal (Comic book reference) with my leg before I d trust these two Jesters. Phobia thought as he

Subject: Can't we all just get along?

Phobia stood back watching the exchange.
"I'd trust a Mechanibal (Comic book reference) with my leg before I'd 
trust these two Jesters." Phobia thought as he watched the exchange 
between the three bots, it was almost ammusing though, neither ones 
function had anything to do with repairs. "If this is the future of 
cybertron then maybe we should all be deleted."

He walked toward the entrance to make sure Megatron didn't return 
unexpectedly, placed a baby there to warn him if he had to stop 
immediately, then turned and returned to the eoom where the operation 
was taking place. When they were done he'd have a few words of 
encouragement for them.

OOC: Logo in the future try not to take things so personally, if 
somethings said to one of the characters, then have the character 
handle it. (IE BA called DM a slut then make BA appologize (Unlikely 
if JP sticks to form) or start a grudge match btw the two.)
And Soulstice, don't try so hard to defend yourself, even if you have 
something to defend yourself against. Whatever it is will pass faster 
if you keep little side comments quiet. (IE you used three posts to 
fight what Logo said just so Logo could find the post and show you 
otherwise.) I don't mean to single you out,  same goes to everyone 
playing. If they (I) can't take a little ribbing from another 
character then he/she/I shouldn't be playing. If we don't like whats 
said about one of our characters then there are other characters in 
the game to take those frustrations out on this is a war and we 
control this war. now lets stop blowing up at each other and get back 
to blowing up each others bots. I said my two cents, anyone else 
doesn't like it I got two characters to take it out on.


  --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "THECODE" <thecode@p...> wrote:
> "Well, actually, you just have to make sure you attach it and it 
still is
> able to be moved." Land Mine said.
> 
> "Would you like me to do it, KitKat?" Land Mine asked...
